description: creep +‎ mouse, from a likening of a person's character and/or behaviour to that of a small, timorous, and often unseen rodent.

adjectives.description: creepmouse (comparative more creepmouse, superlative most creepmouse)

entries.meaning: (mildly derogatory) Timid and unassuming in the extreme.
examples: A box of manuscripts, buried with Ash by Ellen, his creepmouse widow, is opened; the lovers' final secrets are revealed. Ellen, we find, had never let Ash consummate their marriage.

entries.meaning: (mildly derogatory) An extremely timid and unassuming person.
examples: "Pho! pho ! — I do not believe a word of it. Lord Basingstoke is one of those shy young men who are very much attached to any one who will take the trouble of making love to them ; — one of those creepmice who run away with their mother's waiting-maid, or marry an actress for want of courage and patience to encounter the formalities of an honourable courtship.  […]
